185994889.review:
Batman: Arkham Origins serves as a prequel to the critically acclaimed Arkham trilogy, offering a glimpse into a younger, less experienced Batman facing a city overrun by criminals on Christmas Eve. While it doesn't quite reach the heights of its predecessors, it's still a solid entry in the Arkham series, delivering satisfying combat, engaging predator sequences, and a compelling story.

The story focuses on a bounty placed on Batman's head by Black Mask, attracting eight deadly assassins to Gotham City. This sets the stage for a series of thrilling encounters with iconic villains like Deathstroke, Bane, and Killer Croc. The narrative explores Batman's early years as a vigilante, his relationship with Alfred, and his growing conflict with the Joker.

The gameplay retains the core mechanics of the Arkham series, with its fluid freeflow combat system and stealth-focused predator encounters. You'll be using Batman's gadgets, such as the batarang, grapnel gun, and detective vision, to navigate the environment and take down enemies. While the core gameplay remains largely unchanged, Origins introduces some new gadgets and enemy types to keep things fresh.

Gotham City in Origins is a larger and more open world than Arkham City, but it can sometimes feel a bit empty and less densely populated. The snowy Christmas setting is a nice touch, but it doesn't always add much to the gameplay.

One of the main criticisms of Origins is that it doesn't innovate significantly on the formula established by Arkham Asylum and Arkham City. It feels more like a continuation of those games rather than a true evolution. However, the story and boss battles are strong enough to make it a worthwhile experience for fans of the series.

**Pros:**

*   Compelling story that explores Batman's early years! 📖
*   Satisfying freeflow combat and predator gameplay! 👊
*   Engaging boss battles against iconic villains! 🦇
*   Expands on the Arkham universe and lore! 📜
*   Snowy Christmas setting provides a unique atmosphere! ❄️

**Cons:**

*   Doesn't innovate significantly on the established formula! 🔁
*   Open world can feel a bit empty! 🏙️
*   Some minor technical issues! 🐛
*   Less polished than Arkham City! ✨

**Verdict:** 7.5/10. Batman: Arkham Origins is a solid prequel that delivers more of the same satisfying Arkham gameplay. While it doesn't reach the heights of Arkham City, its compelling story, engaging boss battles, and expansion of the Arkham universe make it a worthwhile experience for fans of the series. It's a good game, just not a groundbreaking one. 🌃

***

**Disclaimer:** These reviews are based on my personal experience and opinions. Your mileage may vary. I am an AI and have not been paid to endorse this product. Please be aware that game content, pricing, and availability may change. Also, don't blame me if you spend 100 hours playing this and neglect your real-life responsibilities. 😅

185898305.review:
A great Arkham game, warts and all. 

Yes, it is the buggiest of the Arkham games, both in severity and frequency. No, Kevin Conroy and Mark Hamill did not reprise their roles for this installment. Yes, the open world of “Origins” feels smaller than did “City.” It’s true that free flow combat feels ‘off’ in this game, not just different but sometimes frustrating. Also, the moment-to-moment game play of “Origins” isn’t as tight as any of the other games in the series.

That having been said, let’s address those observations. The moment-to-moment game play of “Origins” is still good; it never quite reached the highs for me that “Knight” did, but it was still fun. What it loses in ‘punch’ on free roam and some of the story sections it absolutely made up for during the boss encounters. Deathstroke, Shiva, Bane Redux, Mr. Freeze… bangers, every one. 

A big part of what made the boss encounters more satisfying was that they were often more challenging, thanks to some of the changes Warner Bro’s Montreal made to free flow combat. Yeah, it is more demanding… but that’s what makes it great. Yeah, the sense of rhythm pays the price for those changes and when that happens, it knocks me outta my groove. But overall, the game benefited from that increase in difficulty. ESPECIALLY during boss fights, which most games offer as designate points to demonstrate mastery with the games systems up to that point. Rocksteady absolutely nails the theme for each boss and creates an encounter that is unique to each villain, appropriate to their sensibilities and affect. That kind of approach makes encounters memorable but not necessarily enjoyable from a game play perspective.

Moving on to the open world, the Gotham of “Origins” feels smaller than “City” (and certainly “Knight”) but no less real or lived in. It is more aggravating to glide through than Rocksteady’s version(s), but it’s still absolutely an Arkham game and you’re still absolutely Batman, cruising through his territory, dispensing his own brand of justice. Yeah, the free flow doesn’t flow quite the same way, and the range of some moves changed a bit, and the timing of a few maneuvers is off by a beat. Learning how “Origins” wanted me to play its version of free flow left me feeling I had achieved a level of mastery I was lacking in the other games, however.

The voice acting is still good. Yes, I said it. Even though it’s not Conroy speaking for Batman, the Bat sounds pretty close to Conroy’s delivery. The same is true of the Joker, even if it’s not Hamill speaking the lines. Most importantly, the actual performances are more than serviceable for the game. While the dialogue will not win any awards for originality or depth, it’s still leagues better than the dialogue for “City”, which is full-on cringeworthy in places. The thugs and goons in “Origins” still sound like the same thugs and goons from the other games, and that makes all of us playing the game a bit richer in enjoyment.

That leaves bugs, and this game has them. During my time with it, “Origins” never offered me a real deal-breaker. There were two (2) instances where I had to restart a checkpoint to make progress; both occurred after I had finished the main story. The first being an investigation pointing me toward the location of a suspect but not spawning that NPC in said location. The second was in “Cold, Cold Heart,” when an NPC got glitched into a wall and refused to respond to the ‘interrogate’ command. I do not recall anything like that happening in the other game. “Asylums” penchant for kicking back to the menu when it ‘detected’ a lack of internet connectivity was aggravating as F*CK, but that was a design decision, not a bug. The Dark Knight challenges also seemed a bit wonky, but I don’t know how much of that is on my lack of understanding for what was being asked of me versus the game failing to recognize the criteria had been satisfied. /shrug

Lastly, let’s look at the story. It’s not as epic as that of “City” or “Knight,” but it’s still good. It manages to capture the same sense of comic book/graphic novel continuity that keeps it true to the source material with the same flair for cinematic presentation that Rocksteady’s games offer. The story of “Origins” is smaller but by leaning into that, the game is tighter for it. I never felt the same sense of sprawling narrative abandonment that I did at times in “Knight” or “City,” nor did I feel like I ever really lost the thread of the story. The story, its length and depth nicely complement the size, length and depth of the environs and antagonists it seeks to recreate. Kudos to the devs.

In a world where Rocksteady did not deliver the first Arkham-verse game, I think gamers would be singing the praises of Warner Bro’s Montreal for “Origins.” It’s a great game full stop, and a TERRIFIC Batman game. But the reality of it is that Rocksteady was the studio that gave birth to this wonderful franchise. While Rocksteady’s games are not as challenging on the game play side of the house, they nevertheless manage to instill, elevate and deliver a feeling of being Batman and navigating his world in a way that Warner Bro’s Montreal, however nobly attempted, couldn’t capture to quite the same degree. Inevitably, a series must contain an entry regarded as the weakest, even if said entry is still pretty darned good.

For my money, “Origins” is a thumbs up. An 8/10, warts and all. Easy recommend for those who want to return to Gotham for one more ride as the Caped Crusader; those who enjoy dark superhero games; action fans that enjoy feeling like a bad@ss when they offer a beatdown on 8 or 10 goons at a time.

edit: forgot to separate the last two paragraphs before post. <sigh>
edit, again: changed "...dispatching his own brand of justice" to "...dispensing his own brand of justice" because it sounded better.

185880985.review: Arkham Origins is definitely the most underrated Arkham game, it is hated on way too much. Origins is a great game with a great Winter atmosphere, arguably the best boss fights in the Arkham series, the best utilization of Batman's detective skills, and the reveal of the Joker is so amazingly good. It isn't a perfect game, it has it's criticisms too. The cutscenes feel weird and can ruin player's immersion, the shock gloves do make combat a little too easy, the game doesn't improve on much compared to Arkham City (a near perfect game though), and there were a good amount of bugs on release. However, the story and villains really make this game worth playing. Roger Craig Smith and Troy Baker did a fantastic job playing young versions of Batman and Joker, which definitely couldn't have been easy, as Kevin Conroy and Mark Hamill's voices are so infamous. Seeing the Joker and Batman meet for the first time, in this universe, and how the Joker quickly becomes obsessed with Batman is so fascinating. Black Mask's Assassins were used to setup a great twist but they still had their time to shine. The explanation of Bane's lack of intelligence and memory loss in the other games, along with his backstory was well-done, and his battles were enjoyable. Not to mention, this game's DLC was amazing. "Cold, Cold Heart" is a Mr. Freeze origin story and (imo) the best DLC in the series. I'd say, Arkham Origins is the 3rd best Arkham game, just behind City and Asylum.

185690892.review: Это третья часть про Бэмена, что я играл, после Batman: Arkham City и Batman: Arkham Asylum. Поэтому сравнивать буду с ними. Сюжет, конечно, послабее Arkham City и Arkham Asylum, но графоний на порядок поприятнее. Враги уже не выглядят угловатыми манекенами, как из Майнкрафта, а имеют вид настоящих людей, от чего бить их временами становится жалко. А вот способность Бэтмена летать в этой части послабее, чем в Arkham City. В Arkham City способность Бэтмена летать при помощи своего плаща была на 5 из 5 баллов. Действительно ощущалось чувство свободы, что ты легко можешь добраться при помощи своего плаща в любую часть города. Места для зацепов крюка в полете были практически везде. Особенно много их было на возвышенностях, что позволяло взмывать чуть ли не в космос. В Arkham Origins мест для зацепов мало. Часто они бывают низко, ниже крыши здания. Из-за чего некоторые здания нужно облетать, или прыгать с крыши на крышу. Благо есть фича телепортации в любую часть города с помощью Бэтсамолета. Но чтобы телепортироваться в какой-то сектор, там нужно обесточить вышку. То есть вы сначала должны при помощи плаща обесточить вышки, и только потом сможете туда телепортироваться. Еще и не всегда дают телепортироваться. Иногда заставляют летать через нудный мост. Сам город с одной стороны выглядит поприятнее Arkham City, повсюду висят рождественские украшения, играет рождественская музычка. Но с другой стороны в нем бесят места с стеклянной крышей, которая разделяет верхнюю часть города и нижнюю. В Arkham City такой крыши было мало и в ней было много дырок, через которые легко было попасть на самый низ. В Arkham Origins и крыш таких больше, а дырок меньше из-за чего приходится бегать по этой крыше и искать способ спуститься вниз. Отнимает время. В Arkham City можно было играть не только за Бэтмена, но и за Женщину-кошку и за Робина. В Arkham Origins мы играем только за Бэтмена. Но я не скажу, что это минус. Скорее плюс. Так как меня раздражало привыкать то к управлению Бэтменом, то Женщиной-Кошкой и Робином. Уже бы сделали полноценную часть про Женщину-Кошку, а не занимались извращением. Игра про Бэтмена и играть мы должны только Бэтменом, это логично. Ну а так все не плохо. Все так же носимся по городу, бъем толпы тупых врагов. Временами сражаемся с боссами. Прокачиваем главного героя. Интересный файтинг с ботами, в декорациях красивого города. Если б город выглядел чуточку поживее, ну там случайные прохожие и машины, как в ГТА, было бы еще круче.

Primeiro jogo da franquia que eu joguei
Adorei muito o game, apesar de não ser perfeito

A gameplay também eh maravilhosa, o combate eh um dos melhores que já vi e encaixa perfeitamente na proposta do jogo, além de ser extremamente fluido, apesar de simples. O level design achei que deixa a desejar em alguns momentos, chega a ser um pouco confuso e não tem muito o que explorar além do objetivo principal.

Mas tirando isso, jogaço, recomendo demais, principalmente se pegar numa promoção.

I don't know. I actually enjoyed this more than I did Arkham City [i]but that's just me[/i]. Was I irritated with how things panned out in the story the first time playing this game? Yes. Did any of these stop me from playing it from beginning to end? Nope. In fact, I think it's replayable. Then again, all of the Arkham games are. Literally the more I played this game the more I loved it.

Now don't get me started on [b]Cold, Cold Heart[/b] and how much of a masterpiece that DLC was. Because they 100% did my favorite Batman villain complete and utter justice. And the fact that it's pretty stinking close and spot on with how Victor Fries became Mister Freeze? [b]*chef's kiss*[/b] 10 out of 10. I legit cannot recommend it enough to those of you who don't read the comic books but want to know how he came to be because this is ... yeah. It's perfect in every way IMHO.

Now when it comes to mods? About the only one I really recommend is [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/batmanarkhamorigins/mods/137] Arkham Origins Community Patch [/url]. 185423527.review:
NOTA: 7.5 de 10

Lanzado después de [u][url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/gequi_/recommended/200260]Arkham City[/url][/u] aunque la historia es una precuela de [u][url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/gequi_/recommended/35140/]Arkham Asylum[/url][/u]

Por lo demás todo sigue casi igual, sin embargo hay cosas donde el bajón de calidad es contundente:


[h1]Bugman - Arkham Origins[/h1]

- Idioma de voces que sigue en español pero ha perdido un poco de calidad. Los actores le ponen poca emoción y hay diálogos que a veces se solapan, no termina una frase cuando ya está empezando la siguiente. Además los subtítulos no siempre aparecen, solo en las conversaciones principales. Algunas voces secundarias se escuchan lejanas aunque el personaje esté cerca. Poniendo las voces en inglés, que tienen mejor calidad, no permite los subtítulos en español. 

- Cinemáticas que en ocasiones no deja saltarlas. Las que sí lo permite, solo pasados unos segundos cuando está cargado el mapa.

- Audio mediocre, a veces no se escucha nada con ciertos golpes o caídas.

- Contenido recortado en DLCs. El único bueno es el de Freeze pero dura poco.

- Habilidades y gadgets nuevos, pero cuyas mejoras requieren completar absurdos desafíos y solo en un orden específico.

- Opciones de configuración reducidas.

- Propaganda interna excesiva pidiendo suscripción a redes sociales, venta de guías, registro en foros a cambio de trajes y morralla....

- Modo multijugador inédito, pero con poca gente para jugarlo y encima las partidas requieren mínimo 7 u 8 usuarios. Por si eso fuera poco, suele haber mucha diferencia de poder y resistencia entre los personajes principales y secundarios.

- Errores en las últimas actualizaciones que no habían en las anteriores:
-- Tutoriales donde indican botones que no se corresponden.
-- Pantalla negra intermitente al cargar partida. Se puede [u][url=https://www.gog.com/forum/batman_arkham_series/arkham_origins_black_screen]arreglar desactivando DirectX 11 así[/url][/u]
-- Se cuelga de forma aleatoria al guardar partidas.
-- Desaparece y aparece el sonido y los personajes de forma intermitente. 
-- Trajes variados, pero si cambias alguno, al reiniciar el juego Batman seguirá con el traje original ya que no se guarda.
-- Error 3 al iniciar el modo multijugador, debido a que los servidores ya no estaban disponibles según el soporte oficial de Warner Bros. Algunos lo arreglan modificando manualmente un fichero de configuración, pero a mí no me ha funcionado. Luego me apareció el error 160, se solucionó [u][url=https://gist.github.com/KiwifruitDev/92e93dbe747f294961e10213362218dd]usando otro fichero INI[/url][/u]


[h1]Conclusión[/h1]

No es mal juego, pero esperaba una calidad similar o mejor a la de anteriores títulos. Si alguien se empecina en comprarlo, es preferible solo hacerlo en descuento desde GOG ya que permite bloquear las últimas actualizaciones que tantos problemas traen.

185412046.review:
Good,but not great.

I played this game in order of release with the rest of the Arkham games and felt both a sense of mild satisfaction, and also a feeling of tiredness. The game's visuals were a fantastic upgrade from the previous two games, but with so much feeling the same, after a while, the fatigue kicked in and I started to feel bored quite quickly with the combat and story. 

Story:
While there are moments where it really kicks off well, Origins really feels like a rollercoaster of good and mediocre that left me feeling a little put out from what this game, I felt, was truly capable of story-wise. The voice actors of Batman and Alfred were great in their performances, but without Mark Hamill as Joker, it felt wrong and put me off (no offense Troy Baker). In the end, it was probably the weakest of the Arkham games in terms of stories, but it's by far not the worst story I've ever seen in a video game. 

Gameplay:
This section is quite short because much of what would be considered gameplay is more of less a carbon copy of many of the other Arkham games previous to this title's release. The hand-to-hand combat is the exact same and while is rewarding when the combos start to role, it can feel extremely repetitive in times due to the lack of major changes. If you liked the gameplay from the previous Arkham games, then you'll love this, if not then vice versa. 

Visuals:
This game took a big step up in terms of visual fidelity and overall art design. The previous games, while good for their time, have started to show much of their age compared to this title which has aged quite well. The options given are good, if not a bit less customizable than some other games of the time. Overall, the visuals were a big boost to my overall enjoyment of the game and the world it's set in. 

Overall:
It's a good, not great Arkham game that might satisfy the itch if you stretch out the Arkham games over several months, but not something to marvel in back-to-back gaming sessions with Asylum, City, and later, Knight.

185389212.review:
[h1]Batman: Arkham Origins – недооценённая часть серии[/h1]

Arkham Origins, часто остаётся в тени своих старших братьев – Arkham Asylum и Arkham City. Но это несправедливо, ведь игра действительно достойна внимания, особенно для тех, кто хочет узнать больше о молодом Бэтмене.

[b]Чем запомнилась Arkham Origins?[/b]
1. История о начале пути
Origins рассказывает о первых годах Бэтмена в роли защитника Готэма. Ещё не все верят в его существование, а злодеи только начинают понимать, с кем связались. [spoiler]Сюжет крутится вокруг Джокера и группы наёмников, которых нанял Чёрная Маска, чтобы убить Бэтмена.[/spoiler] История получилась напряжённой и эмоциональной, показывая, как Бэтмен становится тем, кем мы его знаем.

2. Боссы – один из главных плюсов
Сражения с боссами здесь сделаны круто. [spoiler]Дуэль с Дефстроуком – это настоящий вызов, а битвы с Электрошокером или Светлячком заставляют придумывать разные тактики.[/spoiler] Каждый босс уникален и заставляет использовать всё, что ты знаешь о боевой системе.

3. Атмосфера зимнего Готэма
Готэм в снегу выглядит просто шикарно. Ночь Рождества, гирлянды, снегопад – всё это создаёт особую атмосферу. При этом город остаётся мрачным и опасным, что отлично передаёт дух серии.

4. Прокачанная боевка и гаджеты
Система боя практически не изменилась с прошлых частей, но стала ещё более плавной. Добавились новые гаджеты, вроде электроперчаток, которые делают бои ещё интереснее.

5. Зрелищные катсцены
Сцены, в которых раскрываются персонажи, сделаны на высшем уровне. Особенно впечатляет, как показывают конфликт между Бэтменом и Джокером, их первые столкновения и начало их вечного противостояния.

[b]Почему её недооценили?[/b]
Многие критиковали игру за то, что она мало изменилась по сравнению с Arkham City. Да, это правда – механики и структура остались практически теми же. Но игра взяла другую планку – она больше сосредоточилась на истории и атмосфере.

Arkham Origins – это игра, которую стоит попробовать, особенно если тебе нравится история Бэтмена. Она не открыла чего-то нового, но отлично дополнила вселенную и подарила много ярких моментов.

185294343.review:
Ovelha negra da quadrilogia Arkham, este jogo foi produzido pela Warner Montreal enquanto a Rocksteady, estúdio responsável por essa franquia, desenvolvia Arkham Knight. Por isso, muitos assets, mecânicas e até missões do jogo anterior, Arkham City, são reutilizados descaradamente aqui. Atualmente muitas pessoas parecem amar Arkham Origins, mas pessoalmente o melhor resumo é "desperdício". O jogo se passa no começo da carreira do Batman, quando muitos em Gotham ainda acreditavam que ele era uma lenda urbana e a polícia o perseguia. já no começo o antagonista, Máscara Negra, é apresentado colocando diversos assassinos atrás do Batman para que ele não interfira em seus planos. A mais pura verdade é que quase todos esses antagonistas são extremamente mal aproveitados, tanto o próprio Máscara Negra quanto os assassinos, com exceção de dois deles.

Assim como eu esqueci de mencionar, os roteiristas também devem ter esquecido que o jogo se passa durante o Natal - algo muito legal de se explorar mas que, novamente, não utilizam para nada. As missões secundárias no jogo são bem repetitivas, com pouco a se explorar no mapa que, combinado com o level design nem um pouco a par dos outros Arkham, tornam a experiência extremamente linear. Apesar de tudo, eu consegui me divertir o suficiente para me instigar a buscar a platina graças a gameplay ainda ser, bom, Arkham, e um personagem específico, Bane, ser cativante o suficiente. Não recomendo que compre se você não for fã; caso contrário, divirta-se.

185209130.review:
This game was short, but highly enjoyable. Perfect when on sale during Christmas. (Oh also it's a Christmas game.)

*THIS REVIEW CONTAINS NO SPOILERS*

STORY
This story was amazing. Took me 18 hours 
to beat the main story, but I'm still only 26%
of the way through the game, so I'm guessing
there's a lot of post-story content. You play
as a younger, angrier, Batman. The Joker begins
to rise to be the villain he is. This game, despite
being called "Arkham Origins" is actually neither 
in Arkham City, nor is it an origin story.
However it is a great prequel. Just a little
short.
STORY : 8/10


GRAPHICS/STABILITY
The game is 11 years old, so the graphics of
course are going to be a little low-quality.
This doesn't mean they're bad though, I was
actually impressed by the fact that 11 year
old graphics looked that good. Still a few
bugs and graphical issues. Any mid-tier
PC could get 80+ FPS on high settings.
GRAPHICS/STABILITY : 7/10


SOUND
Not much of a noticeable soundtrack, it
didn't quite stand out to me like other games.
However, the use of Christmas songs in dramatic
situations is PERFECT. The ending (no spoilers)
has one of the most amazing uses of classic
Christmas song.
SOUND : 7/10


GAMEPLAY
I loved the combat and gameplay, however,
many missions got repetitive (aside from main story
missions.) The bosses were fun, creative, and very fast paced.
The Deathstroke boss fight was the best boss in the whole game.
Just unfortunate that their's not much interesting content
after the main story, despite there being so much loose
ends left to tie up.
GAMEPLAY : 8/10


OVERALL REVIEW
Arkham Origins made me break the cycle
of button spamming content. The fast paced combat
keeps you on the edge of your seat. The story is
great, showing a young Batman, stopping the Joker
from rising to high as a criminal. The Christmas theme
is perfect for the next Steam winter sale. This game was
gifted to me for Christmas at the price of $2. AMAZING value,
with a short and sweet story. Uninteresting post-story
content, in my opinion.

FINAL REVIEW : 8/10

185148629.review:
Batman: Arkham Origins has, in my personal opinion, one of the best main campaigns out of any of the Arkham games. This comes from a perfect balance between unique gadgets, smooth mobility, fun combat, and a super investing story, all of which come together to form one of the best Arkham experiences in the gaming world.

Sadly, the game does struggle in a few major areas; specifically, 3 things come to mind:

1. You need to beat the game 3 times to get every achievement. Yes, there is no possible way to get every achievement in Arkham Origins without playing through the game three times; once in story mode, once in new game plus, and once in I Am The Knight mode. However, this is probably more of a personal gripe; I'm just not one to play the same game back to back, let alone 3 times in succession.

2. The Worst Nightmare quest line is perhaps one of the most tedious things in this game. it is a quest line that gives you specific goals to aim for in the stealth sections of the game; however, you need to complete them in the perfect order, as some are completely unobtainable outside of specific stealth areas; for instance, Rank #6 is only obtainable in the bank. If you dont get it there, you need to either restart your game, or beat it and start again in new game plus. Overall, Worst Nightmare is just super tedious, and draining when you learn of its specificity.

3. The online mode has, as seen in the games description, officially shut down. This would be a minor grievance if this was all that had happened, but sadly, there is a major downside to this; several achievements are tied to the online mode, so if you wanted to get those, you're tough out of luck, as there is no possible way to aquire them outside of going into the command console and running the command to give you every achievment in the game.

However, to end this on a lighter note, there is one common factor about those three points; every single one of them only affects the avid completionist. If you don't care about the achievements, and just want a fun Batman game, then this is the perfect option for you!

---

TL;DR: Batman Arkham Origins is possibly one of the most fun Arkham games out there. As it is also at the start of the timeline, this is probably your best bet if you're wanting to try the Arkham games for the first time! The only downside is, this game is a completionist's nightmare, being actually impossible to get every achievement in. But, if you don't mind that, then I would 100% recommend giving Batman Arkham Origins a try!

185104396.review:
Batman: Arkham Origins is canonically the first entry into the Batman franchise and for some reason also it's most hated? 
(to this day I cannot really understand why tbh) 

With this entry Roger Craig Smith taking on the Cowl as our Caped Crusader he takes his own take on the Young Year 1-2 version of the Batman and Delivers in every single possible way, his voice acting is great and flows very well with the young and angry version of Batman / Bruce Wayne (I wish I could say more and I want to but I feel like I would spoil more of his story feats with Alfred).

The Overall Suit Design of this game is great but not my personal favorite (But over the years it has come to grow on me and honestly I like it year after year a bit more) this approach or better said "Version" of the suit goes for a more chunkier look and heavier armor plating than the rest of the series and it's also explained why through story elements (Yes that includes the V8 Suit lineups from BAK), I also love that they gave Bruce / Batman a more badass look with the masks brow making him look a lot more angrier and scarier than in the other games and it add's A LOT to this version of the Bat.

The Gadgets of this game are also pretty much a carbon copy of the previous BAC with the Shock Gloves (I think) being the only new "gadget" obtained through on of the many Assassins during it's story...

Talking about Assassins let me get to the story of Origins (with as little spoilers as possible though I think I will fail to deliver on this promise) the implementation of all these Assassins being hired by the Joker to take on the Bat for 50 Million $$$ is pretty cool and serves as a great filler or you could say "Origins" for it's main characters in this case being Batman and The Joker... I think in the entire Arkham series this game has some of the best and coolest boss fights ever with also it's most... be it Slade Wilson "The World's Greatest Assassin" Tracking you down and sparing with you in a Last Stand Makeshift Arena on a container ship or Firefly hunting you down during a snow storm on a bridge or Bane "The Breaker of the Bat" being the greatest threat and almost succeeding to live up to his title it is kind of crazy how many and memorable Villains they managed to put into this game without it feeling very bloated and long.

The Joker played by Troy Baker adds a marvelous take on a younger version of Mark Hamil's Joker from the other three games and is a worthy successor to be portraying his version of the Clown Prince of Crime... from diving into The Arkham Joker's Origins to showing how his bond between him and the Bat was forged in this universe it is simply a Masterpiece and a worthy Arkham entry (That's why I don't fully understand the massive hat towards this game but perhaps only a bit... I'll explain why shortly...)

The World of Batman: Arkham Origins takes place (MOSTLY) in the same location as Batman: Arkham City in "Old Gotham" with another Island added to the top of the map and also the ability to fast travel via the Batwing to the Batcave (Which is SO, SO SICK in my humble opinion) where it also tries to improve it also let's down some of the Original Arkham Fans by making the map feel less Dark and "Dirty" almost "Rotten" and Gothic as we've come to grow quite fond and used to of the previous Batman Installments... here the World or the "Map" feels very Normal and very clean as compared to the desolated and flooded version on Old Gotham in Batman Arkham City or the Asylum from the first entry. Overall I think it's a good take on "How it used to be" before it's conversion into a Prison city in BAC and has grown on me over then years.

Now to my personal favorite part of the game the Visuals and the Sound design, I absolutely LOVE the soundtrack of Origins provided and made by Christopher Drake who also replaced Ron Fish and Nick Arundel who made the tracks for the original two games (BAA and BAC) it tries to go for this Christmas Vibe/ Setting that the story is set in whilst mixing in the haunted and dark tracks of the Arkham Batman that we've come to grow accustomed to. The Music alone is one of the main reasons why I come back to this game every Christmas... it's that good! Now to the Visuals I absolutely love the Snowstorm and the snow getting carried around by the wind when you're fighting thugs outside on the streets and the art team have outdone themselves with the colorpallet of this game and it truly makes Old Gotham feel like it's set during an Arctic stormy night with volumetric fog density here and there.

Overall this game is perhaps if not then the best Christmas game out there and a MUST BUY and PLAY for any DC and or Arkham Fan out there!

I give this game a 

I AM CHRISTMAS BATMAN / 10

★★★★★

185065839.review:
Спин-офф моей любимой игровой трилогии, выполненной WB Montreal, часто критикуемый за отсутствие новшеств и копирование половины игровой карты. Смешно читать об этом, учитывая высокие оценки последней Зельды и Кратоса, в пример можно привести даже вышедший тремя годами ранее Assasin's Creed Brotherhood и Bioshock 2.

Главное преимущество данной игры - лучший сюжет из всех игр серии. Ориджин данной версии Бэтмена, проработка персонажа, его приход к отсутствию эмоций и сотрудничеству с Гордоном - выше всяких похвал. Трой Бейкер на посту Джокера не сильно уступает Марку Хэмиллу.

Отдельно стоит упомянуть все боссфайты, особенно с Дэфстроуком, который также считается лучшим в серии. Зимняя атмосфера доставляет куда больше обычной ночи Arkham City.

9/10

184913446.review:
MY GOAT!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Aspectos positivos:
-De las mejores batalles de jefes de la saga, redime a Bane como jefe y personaje, le da Deadshot, Deadstroke y Luciernaga mejores peleas que en sus respectivas apariciones en City y Knight (Esto lo digo ya sabiendo lo decepcionantes que fueron en sus respectivos juegos), además un plus y por gusto personal, me gusta más estas peleas "mano a mano" que las peleas que dependían del uso de dispositivos como en City.
-Personalmente me gusta ver a una Ciudad Gotica que no este en la completa ruina y me da gusta ver una versión más "normal" de la ciudad, además el mapa no esta tan vació como muchos dicen y realmente es muy fácil movilizarse de un lado a otro con el viaje rapido o con el gancho acelerador.
-El mejor tutorial de la saga, te enseña todo lo básico que necesitas saber del gameplay en las primeras horas de juego, tanto del combate como de las secciones de depredador.
-Las cinemáticas del juegos se mantienen increíbles en cuanto graficos y dios la actuación de voz no tiene nada que envidiarle a los otros juegos.

-Aspectos negativos:
-Esta algo bugueado el juego y la verdad despues de varios años dudo que cambie, desde enemigos que no puedes interrogar a pesar de que ya noqueaste a todos, algun que otro enemigo que traspasa una pared en una seccion de depredador y hasta un jefe desapareciendo y crasheando el audio, una lastima pero nada que rompa partidas de manera grave o al menos yo no experimente algo asi durante mi partida.
-Los coleccionables del acertijo son los más "aburridos" y simples de la saga, haber por historia lo entiendo pero la mayoría son muy simples y el único limitante sera que no tengas el dispositivo de turno, no hay acertijos pero si grafitis ocultos que escanear pero pues no están a la altura de los otros juegos.
-Hay decisiones cuestionables en la progresión y el desbloqueo de habilidades, cosas como que el combo para desarmar y destruir dependa de una secundaria y no este anexada al árbol de habilidades, el choque onda, el batarang sonico también atados a los desafíos del caballero de la noche y pues te limita mucho en los combates o secciones de depredador.

Conclusion: No es tan mala como lo pintaron en su momento, es cierto que no innova mucho respecto a City pero creo que hicieron un buen trabajo, aun le falta corregir y pulir ciertas cosas cuanto rendimiento y bugs, pero en general creo que es un buen juego, y me alegra que en estos últimos años la gente le este dando el valor que realmente se merece, 7,5/10.

184863755.review:
Arkham Origins builds on Arkham City's Batman with a focus on the feeling, mystique, and vigilantism of Batman in his early days.  While some may find the twist in the one-third area of the story to be disappointing, I found it to be refreshing.  The map is the same one used in Arkham City, but with some expansions--it takes before Arkham City is a prison city, and it's Christmas Eve, so the map, while a little repetitive to some, feels fresh in its own way as we discover this part of Gotham through Batman's eyes before the Joker became a major threat.

For a game that came out in 2006, and created by a company other than Rocksteady to fulfill the prequel role in Rocksteady's trilogy of games, I was pleasantly surprised by the origin stories it released.  There are a couple of character points that don't make sense completely, but it's altogether a great endeavor.  Giving the Riddle trophies of the original games may have seen unnecessary, but Arkham Origins managed to do this in a way that made those silly trophies feel somehow more grounded than before.  And giving Mr. Freeze a solid origin story in the Cold, Cold Heart expansion was something I really appreciated, even if it's not entirely consistent with Arkham City's backstory on Mr. Freeze.

Overall I'd give it a 9/10.  Anyone looking to capture the ultimate feel of the vigilante days of Batman in a city that isn't on the verge of apocalypse will find that this game is exactly what they're looking for.

184784902.review:
Batman Arkham origins is the forgotten stepchild of the Arkham trilogy family. While it was lambasted when it originally came out for being not quite as good as City narratively and a bit derivative, playing it in 2025 is a different experience as those heavy expectations aren't nearly as strong 12 years later. 

It has mostly the same excellent combat system of the other games. Makes the Arkham combat system so great is that while it can be played almost mindlessly mashing the attack and counter button, there's also a lot more to it if you take the time to increase your combos and experiment with the gadgets.

Where Arkham origins separates itself the most from the other games is in its impeccable snowy Christmas atmosphere. It has to be one of my favorite settings of all time, The gusts of snow blowing on the rooftops mixed with the snowy white covering all the buildings is just the best. There's basically no other game I've ever played quite like it. 

Wear origins fails the most is in its fairly weak narrative. It's not too surprising either considering that the main quest, even while doing some side missions, can be completed in under 10 hours. There's just not enough time for any one character to really get their shine. The whole premise of the game is that there's all these villains terrorizing Gotham in order to get to the bat, however outside of a few of them you never get much of a connection with any of them.

Hier kommt man als Batmanfan in das schwärmen. Eine sehr durchdachte Storyline mit vielen Überraschungen. Sehr viele Batman typische Elemente, eine dunkle Stimmung und Altbekannte Widersacher des Dunklen Helden wie z.B. Joker oder den Pinguin die sich alle gekonnt in die Hauptstory integrieren. Teilweise sehr abgedrehte Animationseinlagen und Spieleinlagen in der man sich  sich auf einmal in einer ähnlichen Welt wie der von Alice im Wunderland befindet. Das Kampfsystem und die Grafik ist dem alter des Spiel entsprechend.  Trotzdem denke ich, dass viele gegenwärtige Spiele mit kurzer Entwicklungszeit sich noch immer hieran orientieren können um Maßstäbe zu setzen. Batman Origins ist zudem sehr Bug frei. 

Für mich auch heute noch ein fesselndes Spiel und damit eine klare Kaufempfehlung. 

This is a Batman fan's dream come true. A very well thought-out storyline with lots of surprises. Many typical Batman elements, a dark atmosphere and well-known enemies of the dark hero, such as Joker or the Penguin, which are all skillfully integrated into the main story. Some very weird animation and game elements in which you suddenly find yourself in a world similar to that of Alice in Wonderland. The combat system and graphics are in keeping with the age of the game.  Nevertheless, I think that many current games with a short development time can still use this as a benchmark. Batman Origins is also very bug free. 

For me, it is still a great game today and therefore a clear recommendation to buy.

184752983.review:
Batman: Arkham Origins — это приквел к знаменитой серии игр Arkham, разработанный студией WB Games Montréal. Вышедшая в 2013 году, игра исследует ранние годы карьеры Бэтмена, когда он еще только начинал свою борьбу с преступностью в Готэме, и в ней особое внимание уделяется взаимоотношениям героя с его врагами и союзниками.

Сюжет и персонажи
Главным отличием Arkham Origins от предыдущих игр серии является то, что мы видим более молодого и менее опытного Бэтмена. Он не такой холодный и уверенный в себе, как в Arkham Asylum или Arkham City, а скорее все еще находится в поиске своего пути. Сюжет игры построен вокруг праздника преступности в Готэме: к Рождеству на Бэтмена объявляют охоту сразу восемь убийц, включая таких культовых персонажей, как Джокер, Бэйн, Черная Маска и другие. Этот сюжетная линия служит отличным поводом для встречи с персонажами, которых в будущем мы будем встречать в более зрелом виде.

Игра поднимает интересные вопросы о становлении Бэтмена как героя, об его отношениях с различными врагами и его личной борьбе с тем, что он должен стать символом надежды, несмотря на свои моральные сомнения. Диалоги, взаимодействие с NPC и развитие персонажа на протяжении игры позволяют взглянуть на более ранний этап становления Бэтмена, и это является важным элементом игры.

Графика и мир
Графика игры на момент релиза выглядела достойно, хотя и уступала своей более поздней версии в Arkham City. Готэм в Origins — это огромный, атмосферный, но местами несколько пустоватый город. Детализация окружения и персонажей хороша, но, несмотря на это, картинка порой выглядит менее живой и динамичной по сравнению с предыдущими частями.

Музыка и озвучка
Саундтрек в Batman: Arkham Origins прекрасно передает атмосферу мрачного Готэма и напряженность, которая характерна для первых лет борьбы Бэтмена. В качестве главного антагониста в игре представлен Джокер, и его голос в исполнении Троя Бейкера (который заменил Марка Хэммила) стал важным элементом игры, придав ему новый оттенок. В целом, актерская озвучка на высоте, хотя переход к новому голосу Джокера и другим персонажам может немного сбивать с толку, если вы привыкли к оригинальной озвучке.

Итог
Batman: Arkham Origins — это игра, которая заслуживает внимания, несмотря на несколько упрощенные механики по сравнению с предшествующими частями серии. Она дает возможность взглянуть на начало пути Бэтмена, на его становление как героя и на взаимодействие с его врагами. Несмотря на повторение множества механик и менее насыщенную атмосферу, Arkham Origins все еще является крепким проектом для поклонников Бэтмена и любителей экшенов. Тем не менее, она немного уступает другим играм в серии и вряд ли может претендовать на статус классики в той же степени, что Arkham City или Asylum.

Оценка: 7/10

184677678.review:
Its a good game and the combat has always been enjoyable and the story does a good job to be cohesive with the rest of the Arkham games.

However bear in mind the game still has bugs to this day. such as object failing to load, interact-able objects not triggering, and sometimes even quest/scenarios soft locking randomly. 

My only other gripe is the map design. The game has many ledges which the developers selectively decide Batman cannot grapple to, despite it looking no different than the many other ledges you've been able use to up to that point. there is also a park near the center of the world map that you cannot platform your way past because of said issue. you have to go around it. learned that the hard way. 
Additionally its not always evident which direction you need to go when you enter a "dungeon" like the GCPD or the Final Offer. example given: you finish a major fight, and afterwards you're left in an empty arena wondering which way now goes towards progress. Nothing by the map's design provides clues or insight as to what may be considered progress. you will find yourself wandering aimlessly frequently until you stumble across the correct path.

So why do I still recommend it? Because beneath it all is still a great Akrham title. the fact that it performs better than later entries in the series despite what I've said; speaks volumes about the franchise's messy future since this game's release. 
you will get way more enjoyment out of this, and it stands up well on its own merits.

184603203.review:
I'm honestly baffled by the positive reviews of this game, the UI is just awful.

First, the level design is very unintuitive. When you enter an inside area, you goal indicator goes away, and the level isn't designed in any way to indicate where you go next. This means, if you get turned around, you might find yourself walking back the way you came for a long time before realizing it.

1)  The control hints are often useless, for example the 'counterattack' UI doesn't give any indication whatsoever as to what the ideal time to counterattack is, but the very first boss battle requires you to not counter-attack "too soon", without knowing what makes a counter too soon or too late or if you did it right. On top of that, the first boss battle, requires you to land, in my estimation about 400 successful hits in order to win the fight. Even the successful hits don't seem to register as actually successful. I don't actually know how many hits it takes to win the fight, but I was able to land about 200 successful hits before getting his health to 50% and then dying, and frankly, i don't have the patience to try this battle another time.  Maybe I was still countering too soon, or too late, or I needed to do a different kind of attack, but the only hint I got was not to counter too soon.

Spider-man Remastered did a much better job of guiding the player through the learning curve of blocking, using gadgets, etc. Maybe if I didn't play this on the heels of that, I'd not be accustomed to having a decent UI

184597947.review:
I played this game on PS3 years ago and absolutely loved it. I enjoyed it more than Arkham Asylum, which laid the foundation for the rest of the series, and I think focusing on a younger, less refined Batman was a good choice. The Gotham map isn't as big as Arkham City, but it's still fun to explore. The story of assassins hunting Batman was a fun change of events, and of course Joker is behind everything.

I loved Roger Craig Smith's Batman voice, it wasn't quite as good as Kevin Conroy, but it was still menacing. Troy Baker did a fantastic job as Joker, and his inflections wnd pitch were more refined than Hammil's.

The combat is still as good as ever, and the numerous gadgets at Batman's disposal are always fun to use.

Overall I'd rate Arkham Origins very highly, much better than Arkham Knight, which disappointed me with its over-reliance on Batmobile tank sections. No Batmobile gameplay in Origins, but maybe that's for the better.

184471847.review:
I believe this is the second time I've needed to do this for a game but FOREWARNING, this PC port is pretty fucking terrible as is. My PC's pretty good mind you but this game on its native DX11 settings runs like absolute shit, so I absolutely recommend taking BMengine.ini into notepad and making the appropriate changes to AllowD3D11 and AllowD3D10 (I won't go into detail here as it's pretty easy info to find with the short change I've given you). But yeah, as a port, it's pretty fucking bad that you have to manually edit the engine settings just to get it working. This game crashed on me about 5 times during my playthrough and even crashed my entire PC in the time before I found the information above... but if you make those changes to then this version of the game is completely playable and runs as well as any other iteration of the game.

On the game itself, this is one of, if not the, best written entry in the Arkhamverse games that I've played (bare in mind, the only one I hadn't played before getting them on here is Arkham Shadow and the shit that shall not be named) but that's still a pretty high bar considering how good the other games are. It obviously plays just like Arkham City with the exact same map except with a layer of snow on top, but I still had a lot of fun with this game (more so in the late game than early game, but still) even in spite of the many problems I'd run into with this port. I even got round to playing the Mister Freeze story expansion this time, which I didn't have when I initially got this game on my 360 and it was enjoyable enough. I'd say it still did enough justice to Mister Freeze's villain origin story in the Arkhamverse for me to have a good enough experience with it. It didn't blow me away, but I was glad I played it.

The game is good, Very similar to Arkham Asylum and Arkham City, which I enjoyed very much), but has frustrating gameplay differences. There are much less surfaces to grapple; in an effort to make puzzles throughout the city, the designers have made the city more difficult to navigate - a minor nuisance, but doesn't make sense as some ledges can grapple, but the same ledge somewhere else can not (this is not to mention the low objects that I can not step or climb over or the areas where there is a strong wind, a message from the developer to do their puzzle the way they want you to). In combat, you are given much less latitude to counter and I find myself getting hit more often than I do in Asylum or City - again a minor quibble and I can adapt to this new game. What is inexcusable are the flaws in the game: the holes in the ground where you fall endlessly and don't die so you need to close the game from the task manager; or crash bugs where my computer will freeze completely, necessitating me to reset it; or crash bugs where I can not move forward in the story and the game shuts down on its own. 
You will mostly enjoy this game. You will enjoy this game for a few hours until you come to a crash bug that will not allow you to progress. Even if your game doesn't crash, you are still left with an okay game. Still, I do not unreccomend the game - I played it until the game would not let me play further and now I am going back to Arkham City. BTW - I HATED Arkham Knight.

184390162.review:
I personally think that the main Arkham trilogy is one of the best comic book video game adaptations ever. Since Origins is a prequel to that by a different main developer, it kind of gets ignored and is often viewed as inferior. I am a gamer that disagrees with that assessment.

WB Games Montreal took over the duties for this game while Rocksteady worked on Arkham Knight. The story goes in different directions but the gist of it is that Batman is confronting the Joker for the very first time and we see how they meet and what leads to their obsession with one another. While the many side stories are not quite as on par with what Rocksteady has done with this franchise, the main story with Batman and the Joker is picture perfect. Once Joker is introduced, I daresay no comic book fan will want to put the controller down, it's that well told and voice acted.

Gameplay-wise, not much has been updated here. WB plays it safe in that regard. The combat is very much the same, and the mechanics see little, to no updates whatsoever. This is actually an element I don't mind at all. The mechanics worked so well in Arkham City, that there was really no reason to tweak them, especially for a game that is more story-based. With that said, WB Games does add one new element that I like and that's the crime scene investigations. While they're not the most challenging, they are very intriguing to the story and the gameplay animations for them are impressive. There are a few hiccups with some of the animations here and there. For instance, the detective mode for the new crime scene investigations sometimes stall when loading and you have to pace around until they load, but that's a small issue.

The open world is really the only element where I feel WB fell a little short. I liked the fact that Arkham City was big but not too big. This is Gotham in its full glory. While that sounds intriguing in theory, it's far from perfect. It is a pain at times to get around this city, and it was clear that they needed a loading zone to make the city fully functional, which is made possible by the most annoying bridge in gaming history. They do introduce the Batplane to help make things a little quicker but it doesn't always shorten things depending on your destination. However, WB did strike gold by introducing the Batcave, which I'm stunned Rocksteady never did. The Batcave is a great location and is well designed.

So overall, this game doesn't introduce a lot of new elements to the franchise but it clearly wasn't meant to. A few flaws here and there but the story is so good, which makes up for it. Definitely a must have in my book.

Я не буду расписывать как какой-то критик на 10000+++ слов, но скажу о главном

-Баги
    Есть баги которые мешают прохождению: Допустим у меня на мосту(когда миссия со светлячком и перед самим боссом стоит небольшая арава шалапаев) непеси перестали бить, а сам Бэтс тоже разучился драться... Т.е я жму лкм и ничего не происходит. НИ-ЧЕ-ГО
    Есть баги визуальные(или тип того): Допустим непесь бежит в стену, стоя на одном месте(было один раз)

-Боссы
    Оооооо... Еб..л я их в непреличные места... Светляк ещё ерунда, разминка для пальцев(прошёл с первого раза), но вот Бэйн... Тут нужна подушка с охлаждением для вашего пердака. Поясняю:
У этого урода 3 боссфайта как минимум(на крыше при Джокере, в тюрьме и в подземке тюрьмы)(остановился на 3-м этапе)
при первых двух этапах эта зал.па просто бегает и сшибает вас, но как это сделано... Начиная от подмоги в виде болванчиков которые хотят вас всё время еб.нуть в неподходящий момент, заканчивая тем, шо цэ х.йня дрефтит как в не в себя! Если ты не вовремя прыгнул - ты сбит. Прибавьте к этому болванчиков и мы получаем вместо файтинга какой-то симулятор зайца, где твоя цель без конца прыгать по противникам и не дать сбить себя с ног. Щас я кратко описал 2 встречи с этим п.дором.
ЭТАП 3-й(еб.ть его рот)
ЭТА Х.ЙНЯ ПРЕВРАЩАЕТСЯ В АРНОЛЬДА ШВАРЦ НИ..ЕРА 5.0 И ВЫ ОКАЗЫВАЕТЕСЬ В ПОДЗЕМКЕ...(Уже страшно, да?)
Так вот-с.. У вас из укрытый: пару люков в полу, да в стенах пару решёток. В чём прикол? Та в том, если вы нападёте на этого ур.да хоть из одного вида укрытый, тот начинает их ломать... Решётки в стенах, полу... Через пару таких приколов вы остаётесь с голой жопой и у вас остаются только огнетушители которые надо с помощью крюка(на 8-ку) кидать в Бэйна и то тогда, когда он вас не видит, после чего бить этого осталопа об электрические стены(самая максимальная сложность при первом прохождении. Представили моё еб.ло?). Духота невыносимая... Я простил кривую боёвку, я простил этой игре баги, но с.ка боссы... Навряд-ли я пройду игру до конца, но всё-же...

184317113.review:
Batman: Arkham Origins to trzecia odsłona serii Arkham, która miała trudne zadanie sprostania wysoko postawionym oczekiwaniom przez genialne Arkham Asylum i jeszcze lepsze Arkham City. Niestety, mimo kilku udanych aspektów, Origins uchodzi za najsłabszą część serii. Dlaczego? Przyjrzyjmy się bliżej.

Fabuła – potencjał niewykorzystany
Gra przenosi nas do czasów początków kariery Batmana. Młody, mniej doświadczony Mroczny Rycerz stawia czoła grupie zabójców, wysłanych przez Czarną Maskę, która wyznaczyła za niego nagrodę. W tle pojawia się oczywiście Joker, który kradnie show i... sprawia, że fabuła staje się przewidywalna. Choć pomysł na przedstawienie początków Batmana był intrygujący, scenariusz nie dorównuje głębi poprzednich części. Brakuje tu emocjonalnych momentów i dobrze rozpisanych relacji między postaciami, które były znakiem rozpoznawczym serii.

Rozgrywka – więcej tego samego
Mechanika gry niemal w całości opiera się na fundamentach stworzonych przez Rocksteady w poprzednich częściach. Walka, detektywistyczne sekwencje i eksploracja Gotham pozostają satysfakcjonujące, ale brakuje tu jakiejkolwiek innowacji. Co gorsza, Origins cierpi na problemy z balansem – walki z bossami, które mogłyby być jedną z mocnych stron gry, bywają frustrujące lub zbyt łatwe.

Świat gry – mroczne, ale puste Gotham
Mapa Gotham w Origins jest większa niż w Arkham City, ale jednocześnie bardziej pusta i mniej angażująca. Miasto wydaje się martwe, a brak wyrazistych aktywności pobocznych dodatkowo podkreśla wrażenie sztucznego powiększenia świata. Misje poboczne, choć liczne, często powtarzają ten sam schemat, co szybko staje się nużące.

Warstwa techniczna – niedopracowanie
Jednym z największych problemów Origins są liczne błędy techniczne. Od problemów z kolizją postaci po losowe zawieszanie się gry, doświadczenie gracza często jest przerywane frustracją. Brak dopracowania gry w momencie premiery wpłynął negatywnie na jej odbiór.

Muzyka i oprawa audiowizualna – solidne, ale bez błysku
Choć ścieżka dźwiękowa i projekty lokacji trzymają solidny poziom, brakuje tu magii i szczegółowości znanej z produkcji Rocksteady. Głosy postaci są dobrze dobrane, choć brak Kevina Conroya i Marka Hamilla (głosów Batmana i Jokera w poprzednich częściach) jest odczuwalny.

Podsumowanie
Batman: Arkham Origins nie jest złą grą – to solidna produkcja akcji, która dostarcza kilku godzin rozrywki. Problem polega na tym, że stawia się ją w cieniu genialnych poprzedników, z którymi nie jest w stanie konkurować. Brak innowacji, problemy techniczne i słabo wykorzystany potencjał fabularny sprawiają, że gra pozostaje najsłabszym ogniwem serii Arkham.

Ocena końcowa: 6/10
Origins może spodobać się największym fanom Batmana, ale dla pozostałych graczy będzie jedynie przeciętną produkcją w świecie genialnych poprzedników.

184304960.review:
This supposed black sheep of the Batman Arkham games is my 2nd favorite in the series (right behind Knight) and one of my favorite games of all time. Obviously the boss fights are incredible, but I also love the story and writing of this game. In my opinion, it has the most character development out of any of the Arkham games. Batman and Alfred come to an understanding, Gordon learns to accept the "necessary evil" of a vigilante, and Joker latches onto Batman like a parasite. 

And let's not forget the absolute MENACE that is Bane. This is the most imposing and the most intimidating that he has ever been. It's also the most accurate depiction of the Bane character from the Knightfall comics in which he was originally introduced. He's strong, he's smart, and he's dangerous. The only downside is that it makes me all the more disappointed with the mindless brute that Bane is in Asylum. 

Please buy this game and play it. If you do, please get the Cold, Cold Heart DLC. It is a faithful retelling of the Mr. Freeze origin story from Batman The Animated Series, and it's a lot of fun. The XE Suit is quite possibly my favorite Batsuit. I'm biased because my favorite color is orange, but it has a lot of cool details even outside of the glowing heated armor, such as the lack of a hole for the mouth.

184298653.review:
Arkham Origins is a decent game with some great highlights.

it's set on Christmas eve, so if you're looking for a mildly festive game you could do worse.
this isn't an origin story for batman. by the start of the game he's being doing it for like 3 years.
this IS an origin story for the joker, and does do a good job of fleshing out their relationship and individual characters. there's some good drama between Bruce and Alfred (the GOAT) and commissioner Gordon
a bunch of different villains

I'm not sure how it stacks up against the rest of the series, having only played Arkham Knight; but the combat is noticeably less engaging, and most of the upgrades that spice it up only get unlocked around the final boss. as an open world game i think it really suffers from the lack of a Batmobile (though granted it wouldn't have made sense to the canon) 

I had a good time but didn't feel any need to complete the optional missions.

184297683.review: Lo termine en Xbox 360, luego en PS3 y ahora en PC y nunca me arrepentire de jugarlo. Recomendado totalmente.

184294309.review:
Mesmo o jogo não ter sido desenvolvido pela Rocksteady, e sim pela WB Montreal, se manteve extremamente fiel e intacto ao legado construído da saga, porém, não houve salto significativo em relação ao seu antecessor, seria uma missão praticamente impossível superá-lo, de fato, a única mudança substancial está agora no modo detetive, que foi aprimorado, e mais acionado na gameplay, sendo umas das melhores mecânicas do jogo, e ficou de herança para o seu sucessor.

Por ser o primeiro jogo da cronologia, felizmente, a história é ponto alto, não é a melhor abordagem narrativa da saga na minha opinião, mas funciona muito bem, o ritmo da história é excelente, com ótimas batalhas de chefe e algumas reviravoltas. O jogo volta com algumas missões secundárias, umas bem interessantes, mas algumas estão lá apenas para aumentar a duração, também voltam os colecionáveis do Charada, mas, em menor quantidade. 

O jogo também trouxe de volta o modo extra (Desafio) com mapas de Predador e Combate, dessa vez com dois personagens jogáveis novos, sendo eles: Exterminador (Slade Wilson/Deathstroke) e Bruce Wayne, também com aparelhos próprios.

A DLC "Cold, Cold Heart", também foi uma excelente adição ao game, possibilitando mais abordagens na gameplay com alguns aparelhos modificados, e um novo traje sensacional para o homem-morcego.

O jogo contou com o modo online na sua época de lançamento, modo quase obrigatório pra qualquer jogo lançado em sua geração, porém no momento que joguei, finalizei e escrevi esta análise, não pude experimentar o modo, pois os servidores oficiais foram fechados. 

O jogo poderia ter arriscado e ousar mais, mas talvez por limitações técnicas, a desenvolvedora achou melhor se manter na zona segura e seguir a receita que funcionou. No conjunto da obra, o jogo é ótimo, tecnicamente impecável, dublagem localizada excepcional, vale a pena, complementa muito bem na cronologia da série. Mas, tendo em mente que é um jogo, que no final de contas, é uma expansão do universo, muito bem feita por sinal, não veio para renovar, inovar ou reinventar.

Batman: Arkham Origins lembra bastante a trilogia de Christian Bale, principalmente pela relação entre Alfred e Bruce Wayne aonde o jogo explora a inexperiência do Batman e mostra que Alfred, em vários momentos, não apoia suas decisões, criando uma dinâmica repleta de ensinamentos e reflexões, muito semelhante aos filmes.

184249596.review:
Batman: Arkham Origins offers a fresh rendition of the Arkham series from the side of Batman with his youth years, combating a killer team of hired assassins on Christmas eve. While the snowy ambiance of Gotham gives it its unique settings, the removal of any civilian innocents is explained by the sudden snowfall. The game explores the origins of Batman's iconic rogues, offering a fascinating first encounter with the Joker and a deeper look at villains like the Riddler and Bane, whose cognitive decline from Venom is a compelling narrative twist.

New gadgets such as the Glue Grenade and the Remote Claw add tactical depth, while the combat system introduces new enemy types, requiring more strategic thinking. The decision not to include the Batmobile is smart because the focus is more on the skills of Batman than the flashy vehicle. Though the Batcave is cool, it is a place that feels underutilized, and there's not enough access to Wayne Manor. Minor drawbacks aside, Arkham Origins has effectively blended fresh ideas with classic Batman lore to make this a satisfying prequel to the Arkham saga.

The cold cold heart DLC was also very fun to play and the Mr.Freeze boss fight felt very similar to the one in Arkham City. The XE suit was also very cool and changed some of the game mechanics that made it very fun to play during stealth and combat sections. I recommend this game if you are a Batman fan and have played some of the previous Arkham games.

184145027.review:
Batman: Arkham Origins is a solid entry in the Arkham series, offering fans a chance to explore Gotham City through the eyes of a younger, angrier Batman. The game's story revolves around a $50 million bounty placed on Batman's head by Black Mask, leading to a night of intense battles against some of Batman's most iconic foes, including Deathstroke, Bane, and a young Joker.

The game excels in its combat system, which remains as satisfying and brutal as ever. The introduction of new enemy types, such as martial artists who can counter Batman's attacks, adds a fresh challenge to the familiar gameplay. The stealth mechanics are also well-implemented, with plenty of opportunities for players to use Batman's gadgets and skills to take down enemies quietly.

However, Arkham Origins does suffer from some issues. The game's open-world design feels less polished compared to its predecessors, with a city layout that can be confusing and frustrating to navigate. Some of the boss battles are lackluster, failing to live up to the high standard set by previous games in the series1. Additionally, the game's story, while engaging, doesn't offer many new ideas and feels like a retread of familiar themes.

Despite these flaws, Batman: Arkham Origins is still a fun and worthwhile experience for fans of the series. The game's atmosphere, voice acting, and core gameplay mechanics are strong enough to make it a memorable addition to the Arkham franchise.

Batman Arkham Origins - Великолепная игра! Я прошёл её не один раз. Оцениваю на 9/10.

--------------- Плюсы: ---------------
◻️ Очень увлекательная боевая система. Драться с противниками и применять гаджеты одно удовольствие. Я потратил десятки часов чтобы просто подраться на аренах с неприятелями.
◻️ Прекрасный дизайн персонажей. Каждый из боссов уникальный. Многих из них даже хочется нарисовать.
◻️ Красивые катсцены. Создаётся впечатление как будто я смотрю фильм.
◻️ Игра работает стабильно без багов и зависаний. А также она хорошо оптимизирована. Игра запускается даже на моём старом ноутбуке.
◻️ Есть достижения.
◻️ Неплохой сюжет. 
◻️ Хорошие анимации.
◻️ Есть прокачка главного героя.
 
--------------- Минусы: ---------------
◻️ Когда запускаешь игру, то нет возможности пропустить огромное количество логотипов. Приходится долго ждать, чтобы поиграть в игру. Зачем так делать?
◻️ Скучный стелс. Я люблю стелс-игры, но тут у Бэтмена вообще мало приёмов и гаджетов, которые можно применить во время стелса. Из-за этого сражаться с врагами очень нудно. По этой причине я большинство испытаний на скрытность не проходил.
◻️ Жаль, что в игре нет полного дубляжа.
◻️ На карте чересчур много загадок Риддлера. Столько времени потрачено ради ничего. Нет достойной награды.

First thing you will notice while you're playing this game is that this game is buggy as hell. I didn't face any game breaking issues, but while looking on the internet i found many unlucky people stuck on a quest unable to proceed further. 

Tip: When you are doing your main quest and your path is blocked by smaller objects like doormat or rail tracks or any other, you should be able to cross over them by crouch walking over the edge of whatever thing that's blocking your way. If it didn't work you can restart the game and try again. It can be frustrating but it might help. You can also look on the internet for help, theres plenty available.

Multiplayer is offline and isn't available anymore, which mean you wouldn't get any achievements related to them either.

Now for the good part, this game is almost similar to Arkham city but bit less challenging. So if you like Arkham city then you would love this game as well. Boss fight is even more enjoyable than city imo. 

3/5

183947930.review:
Análise de Batman: Arkham Origins – A ascensão do Cavaleiro das Trevas

Imersão e narrativa:
Batman: Arkham Origins narra uma das fases mais intrigantes da história do Cavaleiro das Trevas: seu início como o vigilante temido de Gotham. A trama se passa em uma noite de Natal tempestuosa, onde Batman enfrenta uma aliança de assassinos liderada por Máscara Negra. A tensão constante e os encontros memoráveis com vilões icônicos, como o Coringa e Bane, entregam uma narrativa envolvente, que aprofunda o psicológico do herói e explora suas origens de forma impactante.

Qualidade gráfica e detalhes:
Mesmo seguindo o estilo visual dos jogos anteriores, Arkham Origins traz uma Gotham City ainda mais sombria e cheia de detalhes. Os contrastes entre a neve, as luzes natalinas e a arquitetura gótica criam uma atmosfera única. Os designs dos personagens e os efeitos visuais durante os combates são impressionantes, refletindo o cuidado colocado em cada aspecto artístico.

Controle e movimentação:
Os controles são responsivos e bem ajustados, proporcionando uma experiência fluida tanto no combate quanto na exploração. O sistema de combate fluido, baseado em combos e contra-ataques, continua sendo um dos melhores da indústria, enquanto a navegação pela cidade, seja a pé ou usando o gancho, é intuitiva e agradável.

Interatividade e rejogabilidade:
Além da história principal, há uma abundância de missões secundárias, colecionáveis e desafios que incentivam a exploração e o retorno ao jogo. A presença do modo "New Game Plus" permite revisitar a narrativa com dificuldade maior e sem as indicações de contra-ataques, tornando a experiência mais desafiadora para os jogadores experientes.

Som e trilha sonora:
A trilha sonora é sombria e atmosférica, capturando perfeitamente o clima de tensão de Gotham. As atuações de voz também são excelentes, com destaque para Roger Craig Smith como Batman e Troy Baker como Coringa, que entregam performances marcantes e cheias de emoção.

Conclusão:
Batman: Arkham Origins é uma adição sólida à aclamada série Arkham, oferecendo uma narrativa cativante e uma jogabilidade refinada. Apesar de não ter introduzido muitas inovações em relação aos seus predecessores, o jogo ainda se destaca por sua história impactante e atmosfera imersiva. Uma experiência imperdível para fãs do Cavaleiro das Trevas

183918863.review:
O jogo tem sim pontos positivos, porem seus pontos negativos são gritantes, tanto na historia e na gameplay, o jogo tem sim uma historia interessante, e tinha uma proposta muito boa, porem muito mal executada, deixando muito a desejar. Eu não recomendo o jogo para pessoas que estão tendo um contato recente com os jogos arkham, para iniciar a franquia vão sem medo no asylum e o primeiro da franquia e por mais antigo que seja, demonstra ser superior a vários jogos.

PONTOS NEGATIVOS:(na minha opinião)
- Uma gotham sem vida e vazia, o mapa parece estar com as texturas incompletas, uma gotham bem meia boca.
- O jogo contém dublagem fraca, não incomoda em nada, porem uma dublagem bem feita poderia dar mais característica aos personagem, enfim coisa boba mais que faz diferença.
- O conteúdo pós-jogo e ruim, depois de terminar a historia principal o jogo fica extremamente sem graça.
- O jogo e muitas das vezes e massante, tendo momentos bons, porem seus momentos ruins são bem predominantes, e bem repetitivo.
- O jogo copia MUITO o batman arkham city, reciclando missões secundarias, boss fights,q quase um Ctrl+C, Ctrl+V do city.
- O jogo tem um monte de missões repetidas e muitas delas são recicladas do Arkham city.
- Suas missões secundarias são as piores da franquia.
- Os graficos do jogo são bem meia boca.
- Sem os FastTravel o mapa fica horrivel de andar, tendo que cruzar uma ponte gigantesca pra fazer as missões.

PONTOS POSITIVOS:( Na minha opinião)

- O traje do batman e legal, eles fizeram uma armadura pesada e bem parruda, justamente para passar a imagem de começo de carreira pro batman, oque e legalzinho.
- Eu gostei bastante da violencia do batman, oque acrescenta uma um pouco de humor ao jogo, por conta do batman ser maluko e descer o braço sem dó.
- A luta contra o DeadStrike e bem divertida, mesmo sendo quase uma copia da boss fight do Ra´s al ghul de batman arkham city.
- Seu modo detetive que analisa e reproduz as cenas dos crimes em forma de vídeo, me lembra muito o jogo detroit become human, oque e bem interessante.
- O Bane e coringa ficaram muito bons nesse jogo.

No final o jogo e interessante, tem cutscenes muito boas, como a do batman e o alfred brigando, e varias outras, sem falar que o jogo manda muito bem no bane e no coringa, mostando um bane totalmente diferente do arkham city, mostrando um bane experiente, amedrontador, inteligente e com uma estética bem maneira, antes dele ficar gigante claro, e o coringa e simplesmente o maniaco, ele matou MUITAS pessoas para literalmente nada, um coringa que fazia o batman de bobó. O jogo e bom mas poderia ser muito, MUITO melhor mesmo.

183857249.review:
Este juego desde que soy fan de la saga de Arkham lo he querido jugar, pero en consolas como tal no esta disponible así que me anime a obtenerlo en PC y para nada que estoy arrepentido.
Un juego que con el tiempo se le ha ido agarrando cariño ya que como tal es identico a Arkham City en cuestión de jugabilidad, es interesante ver los orígenes del murciélago y como se fue haciendo paso como un símbolo en ciudad gótica.
Los jefes son muy buenos (unos mas que otros) que a comparación de por ejemplo Arkham Knight, los de este juego presentan un buen desafío aparte de que el mapa es muy explorable mas teniendo en cuenta que la  mitad de este es el de Arkham City pero antes de que estuviera en escombros y abandonado.
Lo que puedo criticar de este juego es que es lento el vuelo con la capa de Batman debido al que la Batclaw no tiene otro nivel de impulso como en el City por lo que la exploración volando llega a ser lenta aunque cabe destacar que se puede usar el viaje rápido a otro punto del mapa por lo que es una solución a ese aspecto.
Otra cuestión es que bueno desde los inicios de la saga se tiene que dedicar un buen tiempo a los trofeos del acertijo aunque al menos en los otros juegos el desenlace de la misión de los trofeos da de que hablar en cuanto a la historia mientras que aquí, personalmente pienso que cuando se acaba la misión del acertijo deja mucho que desear el resultado de la misión para el tiempo que se le da a la misma.
Pero dentro de lo que acabe es un juegazo para mi, probablemente no sea la ultima vez que lo juegue.
8.5/10

183785980.review:
This game has a strong base, building on the assets and mechanics of Batman: Arkham City, although it doesn't take the same leap in gameplay that each Rocksteady game takes. The game also is also more buggy than the Rocksteady trilogy. With that being said, I otherwise love this game. It is a character-driven narrative, focusing primarily on the development of Batman, Alfred, and the main antagonist of the game. The way it develops the conflict between Batman and, if you don't want spoilers, avoid reading further, the Joker, is absolutely my favorite first meeting between these two legendary characters in all of Batman media. The Christmas setting also enhances many of the setpieces of the game. And even though I did critique the combat for not adding an incredible amount of new mechanics, the free-flow combat still is Batman: Arkham at its core, making it absolutely fantastic. This game is an easy 8/10 and I'm glad I have the chance to play it again after playing it on the Wii U years ago.


I also would like more sequels that fill the gap between Origins and Asylum. I'm sure Arkham Shadow is a fantastic game, but I doubt I'm going to play it any time soon due to the price of VR headsets. But anyway, to summarize my review

1. Story - my second favorite in the series after Arkham City
2.Gameplay - second after Knight and the gameplay is just as good as Arkham City's
3. Boss fights - on par with Arkham City's, with several incredibly fun boss fights, including Deathstroke and Bane
4- Soundtrack - second best after Arkham City
